Package org.daiitech.naftah.builtin.time

Record Class ArabicDate

java.lang.Object
java.lang.Record
org.daiitech.naftah.builtin.time.ArabicDate
Record Components:
date - the parsed date component
calendar - the optional calendar specification
temporal - the resolved temporal
All Implemented Interfaces:
ArabicTemporal, ArabicTemporalPoint, DateSupport
public record ArabicDate(ArabicDate.Date date, ArabicDate.Calendar calendar, Temporal temporal) extends Record implements ArabicTemporalPoint, DateSupport
Represents an immutable Arabic date composed of:
  • A ArabicDate.Date component (day, month, year)
  • An optional ArabicDate.Calendar component
  • A resolved Temporal representation

This record is typically produced after parsing Arabic date expressions and resolving them against a specific Chronology.

It supports both Gregorian and non-Gregorian calendars (e.g. Hijri) and preserves the original Arabic month and calendar names.

Author:
Chakib Daii

  • Method Details

    • now

      public static ArabicDate now()
      Obtains the current date using the default chronology and the system default time zone.

      This method is equivalent to invoking: now(ChronologyUtils.DEFAULT_CHRONOLOGY, null).

      Returns:
      the current ArabicDate

    • now

      public static ArabicDate now(Chronology chronology)
      Obtains the current date using the specified chronology and the system default time zone.

      The supplied chronology determines how the current day, month, and year are interpreted.

      Parameters:
      chronology - the chronology to use (not null)
      Returns:
      the current ArabicDate
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if chronology is null

    • now

      public static ArabicDate now(ArabicDate.Calendar calendar)
      Obtains the current date using the specified calendar and the system default time zone.
      Parameters:
      calendar - the calendar to use (not null)
      Returns:
      the current ArabicDate
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if calendar is null

    • now

      public static ArabicDate now(ArabicTime.ZoneOrOffset zoneOrOffset)
      Obtains the current date using the default chronology and the specified zone or offset.

      This method is useful when resolving the current date relative to a specific time zone or fixed offset.

      Parameters:
      zoneOrOffset - the zone or offset to use, or null to use the system default
      Returns:
      the current ArabicDate

    • now

      Obtains the current date using the specified chronology and zone or offset.
      Parameters:

      zoneOrOffset - the zone or offset to use, or null to use the system default
      Returns:
      the current ArabicDate
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if chronology is null

    • now

      public static ArabicDate now(ArabicDate.Calendar calendar, ArabicTime.ZoneOrOffset zoneOrOffset)
      Obtains the current date using the specified calendar and zone or offset.

      The returned ArabicDate represents the current calendar date as resolved by the provided calendar and zone or offset.

      Parameters:
      calendar - the calendar to use (not null)
      zoneOrOffset - the zone or offset to use, or null to use the system default
      Returns:
      the current ArabicDate
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if calendar is null

    • of

      public static ArabicDate of(ArabicDate.Date date, ArabicDate.Calendar calendar, Temporal temporal)
      Creates a new ArabicDate instance from its parsed components.

      This factory method should be used when the Date, the ArabicDate.Calendar, and the underlying Temporal representation are already known. No additional parsing or chronology resolution is performed.

      Parameters:
      date - the parsed date component (day, month, year) according to the calendar
      calendar - the calendar associated with this date (e.g., Gregorian or Hijri)
      temporal - the resolved temporal representation backing this date
      Returns:
      a new ArabicDate instance combining all components

    • of

      public static ArabicDate of(ArabicDate.Date date, ArabicDate.Calendar calendar)
      Creates a new ArabicDate instance from its parsed components and resolves the underlying Temporal representation automatically.

      This factory method should be used when the Date and the associated ArabicDate.Calendar are already known, but the backing Temporal has not yet been created. The temporal representation is derived using the calendarâ€™s chronology.

      Parameters:
      date - the parsed date component (day, month, year) according to the calendar
      calendar - the calendar associated with this date (e.g., Gregorian or Hijri)
      Returns:
      a new ArabicDate instance combining all components

    • of

      public static ArabicDate of(ArabicDate.Calendar calendar, Temporal temporal)
      Creates a new ArabicDate instance from a Temporal object and a calendar.

      This method extracts the day, month, and year fields from the given temporal object and constructs an ArabicDate using the provided calendar's chronology.

      The temporal must support the following fields:

      • ChronoField.DAY_OF_MONTH
      • ChronoField.MONTH_OF_YEAR
      • ChronoField.YEAR

      Parameters:
      calendar - the calendar that determines the chronology of the date
      temporal - the temporal object containing date information
      Returns:
      a new ArabicDate instance derived from the temporal
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the temporal does not support day, month, or year fields

    • of

      public static ArabicDate of(int day, String arabicMonth, int year)
      Creates a new ArabicDate instance using a day, Arabic month name, and year.

      This method uses the default chronology defined in ChronologyUtils.DEFAULT_CHRONOLOGY.

      Parameters:
      day - the day of the month
      arabicMonth - the Arabic month name (e.g., "Ø±Ù…Ø¶Ø§Ù†", "ÙŠÙ†Ø§ÙŠØ±")
      year - the year value
      Returns:
      a new ArabicDate instance with the specified components

    • of

      public static ArabicDate of(Chronology chronology, int day, String arabicMonth, int year)
      Creates a new ArabicDate instance using a specific chronology, day, Arabic month name, and year.

      The chronology is used to resolve the month name to its numeric value and to determine leap years.

      Parameters:
      chronology - the chronology to use (e.g., ISO or Hijri)
      day - the day of the month
      arabicMonth - the Arabic month name
      year - the year value
      Returns:
      a new ArabicDate instance with the specified components

    • of

      public static ArabicDate of(ArabicDate.Calendar calendar, int day, String arabicMonth, int year)
      Creates a new ArabicDate instance using a calendar, day, Arabic month name, and year.

      The Arabic month name is resolved to a numeric month using the provided calendar's chronology.

      Parameters:
      calendar - the calendar to use
      day - the day of the month
      arabicMonth - the Arabic month name
      year - the year value
      Returns:
      a new ArabicDate instance with the specified components

      Parameters:

      year - the year value
      Returns:

      The chronology is used for leap year calculations and month name resolution.

      Parameters:
      chronology - the chronology to use (e.g., ISO or Hijri)

      month - the numeric month value (1â€“12)
      year - the year value
      Returns:
      a new ArabicDate instance with the specified components

    • of

      public static ArabicDate of(ArabicDate.Calendar calendar, int day, int month, int year)
      Creates a new ArabicDate instance using a calendar and numeric day, month, and year.

      The calendar provides the chronology to resolve leap years and month names.

      Parameters:
      calendar - the calendar to use
      day - the day of the month
      month - the numeric month value (1â€“12)
      year - the year value
      Returns:

    • toChronoDate

      public ChronoLocalDate toChronoDate()
      Returns this date interpreted in its calendar chronology.

      The returned ChronoLocalDate is derived from the underlying ISO temporal and the associated Chronology.

      This method must be used whenever calendar-specific fields (year, month, day) are required.

      Returns:
      a ChronoLocalDate in the calendar's chronology

    • getDayOfWeek

      public String getDayOfWeek()
      Returns the day of the week as an Arabic string for this ArabicDate.

      The calculation is based on the epoch day of the underlying ChronoLocalDate.

      Specified by:
      getDayOfWeek in interface DateSupport

    • isLeapYear

      public boolean isLeapYear()

      Specified by:

      Returns:
      true if the year is a leap year, false otherwise

    • lengthOfMonth

      public int lengthOfMonth()
      Returns the length of the month in days for this ArabicDate.

      The length is determined according to the chronology of the calendar.

      Specified by:
      lengthOfMonth in interface DateSupport
      Returns:
      the number of days in the month

    • lengthOfYear

      public int lengthOfYear()
      Returns the length of the year in days for this ArabicDate.

      The number of days depends on the chronology of the date:

      • For Gregorian years (ISO chronology), leap years return 366 days, and non-leap years return 365 days.
      • For Hijri years, leap years return 355 days, and non-leap years return 354 days.

      Specified by:
      lengthOfYear in interface DateSupport
      Returns:
      the number of days in the year according to its chronology

    • compute

      ArabicDate compute(ArabicTemporalAmount arabicTemporalAmount, Function<TemporalAmount,Temporal> computeFunction)
      Computes a new ArabicDate by applying the given temporal computation.

      Date-based arithmetic supports:

      • ArabicPeriod
      • ArabicDuration of at least 24 hours
      • ArabicPeriodWithDuration

      Durations shorter than 24 hours are not permitted for date-only values.

      Parameters:
      arabicTemporalAmount - the temporal amount to apply
      computeFunction - the temporal computation function
      Returns:
      a new ArabicDate instance
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the operation is not supported

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a string representation of this ArabicDate in the format: "date calendar".

      If a ArabicDate.Calendar component is present, it is appended after the date. Otherwise, only the date is returned.

      Specified by:
      toString in class Record
      Returns:
      a formatted string representing the Arabic date and optional calendar

    • hashCode

      public final int hashCode()
      Returns a hash code value for this object. The value is derived from the hash code of each of the record components.
      Specified by:
      hashCode in class Record
      Returns:
      a hash code value for this object

    • equals

      public final boolean equals(Object o)
      Indicates whether some other object is "equal to" this one. The objects are equal if the other object is of the same class and if all the record components are equal. All components in this record class are compared with Objects::equals(Object,Object).
      Specified by:
      equals in class Record
      Parameters:
      o - the object with which to compare
      Returns:
      true if this object is the same as the o argument; false otherwise.
